feature.name: Druid Circle: Circle of Griffon
feature.text: This druid is a warrior that protects nature. They are trained to guard the wilderness and stand their ground against evil.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of Griffon: Circle Spells
feature.text:
Circle of the Griffon Spells:
Druid Level | Circle Spells
2nd | cure wounds, thunderwave
3rd | barkskin, flame blade
5th | call lightning, dispel magic
7th | blight, wall of fire
9th | mass cure wounds, wall of stone
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Fighting Style
feature.text: You adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take the same Fighting Style option more than once, even if you get to choose again.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Archery
feature.text: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with ranged weapons.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Dueling
feature.text: When you are wielding a melee weapon in one hand and no other weapons, you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with that weapon.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Fighting Style: Two-Weapon Fighting
feature.text: When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of the second attack.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Unarmed Fighting
feature.text: Your unarmed strikes can deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d8 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier on a hit. At the start of each of your turns, you deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage to one creature grappled by you.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Elemental Resistance
feature.text: You are resistant to two of the following damage types: cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Extra Attack
feature.text: You can attack twice with a melee or ranged weapon.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Griffon Shape
feature.text: You are able to wild shape into a griffon as part of your Wild Shape feature.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)

feature.name: Circle of the Griffon: Evasion
feature.text: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.
Source: Cawood, Monsters of the Wilderness p. 150 (ThirdParty)
